FAQ.TITLE: Frequently Asked Questions
FAQ.INTRO: We know moving abroad for work can feel uncertain. Here are honest answers to the questions we hear most often.

QUESTIONS.q: Do I need a diploma or special education to work abroad?
QUESTIONS.a: No. Most positions we offer (factory, warehouse, logistics, seasonal work, cleaning, hotel service, etc.) do not require higher education. What matters most is motivation and reliability.

QUESTIONS.q: Can I work abroad if I have a 'grey passport' or non-EU citizenship?
QUESTIONS.a: Yes. We work with licensed agencies that arrange legal work permits for non-EU citizens. Many of our candidates from Latvia, Estonia, and other post-Soviet countries have already worked successfully in the EU with Monova’s help.

QUESTIONS.q: What if I speak only one language?
QUESTIONS.a: That’s completely fine! Many employers don’t require English or local language skills. Our coordinators speak your language and explain everything clearly — from contract to accommodation.

QUESTIONS.q: Do I need to pay Monova for finding me a job?
QUESTIONS.a: No. Our service is 100% free for candidates. We are paid by employers who need reliable workers. You should never pay anyone for getting a job through Monova.

QUESTIONS.q: Who will be my actual employer?
QUESTIONS.a: You sign the contract directly with a licensed European employer or partner agency. Monova helps you find, apply, and relocate safely — we are your support, not the hiring company.
Most job offers include organized housing or help finding accommodation. The details (price, distance, facilities) are always explained before you decide to travel.

QUESTIONS.q: Is transport from my country included?
QUESTIONS.a: In some cases yes, in others we help you arrange low-cost options or reimburse travel after the first salary. You always receive travel guidance before departure.

QUESTIONS.q: Can couples or friends apply together?
QUESTIONS.a: Yes. We often place couples and groups of friends together, especially in warehouse and production jobs. Just mention this in your application.

QUESTIONS.q: How long does the process take?
QUESTIONS.a: It depends on the country and type of job — usually 3–10 days from registration to job offer, and 1–3 weeks until travel.

QUESTIONS.q: What support will I get after arrival?
QUESTIONS.a: Our local partners meet you on-site, help with registration and onboarding. You can contact Monova anytime during your stay if you need assistance.
